title: Kale Caesar with Sourdough Crumbs
description: A bright, crunchy kale Caesar tossed in a tangy, anchovy-garlic dressing and finished with crisp, buttery sourdough crumbs. Robust umami from anchovy and Parmesan contrasts fresh lemon and kale for a satisfying vegetarian-friendly salad that stands up as a main or hearty side.

ingredients.display_name: lacinato or curly kale, stems removed and chopped
ingredients.notes: trim tough stems, chop into bite-size ribbons

ingredients.display_name: sourdough bread, crusts removed, torn into 1/2-inch pieces
ingredients.notes: day-old bread works best for toasting into crumbs

ingredients.display_name: anchovy fillets packed in oil, drained and minced
ingredients.notes: mash into a paste for dressing
to taste; some will be in cheese and anchovy
optional for a hint of heat
can combine with butter for higher smoke point

steps.text: Prepare ingredients: remove stems from kale and chop into bite-size ribbons; tear sourdough into small pieces; finely mince anchovies and garlic; grate the Parmesan; juice the lemon.

Make sourdough crumbs: heat a large skillet over medium, add butter and olive oil until foaming, then add torn sourdough pieces and cook, stirring frequently until golden brown and crisp (about 6–8 minutes). Transfer to a plate to cool, then pulse briefly in a food processor or crush by hand to make coarse crumbs.

Combine dressing ingredients: in a medium bowl whisk together minced anchovy, minced garlic, mayonnaise, Dijon mustard, lemon juice, grated Parmesan, and capers if using. Slowly whisk in olive oil until emulsified. Season with black pepper and a small pinch of salt; taste and adjust acidity or salt as needed.

Massage the kale: place chopped kale in a large bowl, add a couple tablespoons of the dressing (or water if preferred) and a pinch of salt, then massage with clean hands for 2–3 minutes until leaves soften and darken.

Toss salad: add most of the remaining dressing and about two-thirds of the sourdough crumbs and half the grated Parmesan to the massaged kale. Toss thoroughly to coat, adding more dressing a little at a time until desired creaminess is reached. Adjust seasoning with salt, pepper, and lemon as needed.

Serve: divide salad among plates or a large platter, sprinkle remaining sourdough crumbs and extra Parmesan over the top, finish with a light drizzle of olive oil and an optional pinch of red pepper flakes.
